name: Chat
description: Functions for interacting with chat. Accessible from scripts via the global `Chat` variable.

methods.name: log
methods.description: Logs a message into chat.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to log into chat

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: Block the thread until the message is sent

methods.name: logf
methods.signature: logf(String message, boolean await, Object[] args)
methods.description: Sends the formatted message to the local chat. The message is formatted using the default java.lang.String.format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) syntax.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to format and log

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: Block the thread until the message is sent

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: The arguments used to format the message

methods.name: logColor
methods.description: Logs a message to chat, replacing any ampersands with section symbols to be used with the minecraft chat formatting.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to log into chat

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: Block the thread until the message is sent

examples: Chat.logColor("Colors: &0Black &1Dark Blue &2Dark Green &3Dark Turqoise &4Dark Red &5Purple &6Dark Yellow &7Light Gray &8Dark Gray &9Light Blue &aLight Green &bLight Turquoise &cLight Red &dMagenta &eLight Yellow &fWhite");

methods.name: say
methods.description: Sends a message in chat.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to send in chat

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: Block the thread until the message is sent

methods.name: sayf
methods.signature: sayf(String message, boolean await, Object[] args)
methods.description: Sends the formatted message to the server. The message is formatted using the default String#format(java.lang.String, java.lang.Object...) syntax.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to format and log

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: Block the thread until the message is sent

parameters.name: args
parameters.description: The arguments used to format the message

examples:
const name = "John";
Chat.sayf("Hello everyone! I'm %s and I've run %.2f meters.", [name, 100.93]);
Chat.sayf("Hello everyone! I'm %s and I've run %.2f meters.", true, [name, 100.93]);

methods.name: open
methods.description: Opens the chat screen with the provided message.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description: The message to open the chat screen with

parameters.name: await
parameters.description: Block the thread until the chat is opened

examples: Chat.open("This message is in the chat input box");

methods.name: title
methods.signature: title(Object title, Object subtitle, int fadeIn, int remain, int fadeOut)
methods.description: Displays a title and subtitle on screen.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The primary title to display

parameters.name: subtitle
parameters.description: The subtitle to display

parameters.name: fadeIn
parameters.description: Time in seconds to fade the text in

parameters.name: remain
parameters.description: Time in seconds the text will remain on screen

parameters.name: fadeOut
parameters.description: Time in seconds to fade the text out

methods.name: actionbar
methods.description: Displays text on the action bar.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to display

parameters.name: tinted
parameters.description: Whether the text should appear tinted

examples: Chat.actionbar("You may not rest now; there are monsters nearby‌");

methods.name: toast
methods.description: Toasts are informational text boxes shown on the top right corner of the screen.

parameters.name: title
parameters.description: The title of the toast

parameters.name: desc
parameters.description: The description of the toast

examples: Chat.toast("New Recipes Unlocked!", "Check your recipe book");

methods.name: createTextHelperFromString
methods.description: Initializes a TextHelper from a string.

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: Text to initialize with

methods.name: createTextHelperFromTranslationKey
methods.description: Initializes a TextHelper from a translation key.

parameters.name: key
parameters.description: Translation key to initialize with

parameters.name: content
parameters.description: objects to be used to initialize a dynamic translation key with

methods.name: getLogger
methods.description: Gets an SLF4J logger for logging to console.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: The logger name

methods.name: createTextHelperFromJSON
methods.description: Initializes a text helper from JSON text.

parameters.name: jsonText
parameters.description: The json text used to build the text helper

methods.name: createTextBuilder
methods.description: Creates a new text builder.

methods.name: createCommandBuilder
methods.description: Creates a builder used to create commands. Deprecated: Use Chat.getCommandManager() when possible.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the command

methods.name: unregisterCommand
methods.description: Unregisters a command. Deprecated: Use Chat.getCommandManager() when possible.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Name of the command to unregister

methods.name: reRegisterCommand
methods.description: Re-registers a command. Deprecated: Use Chat.getCommandManager() when possible.

parameters.name: node
parameters.description: The node to re-register

methods.name: getCommandManager
methods.description: Gets the command manager.

methods.name: getHistory
methods.description: Gets the manager to access chat history.

methods.name: getTextWidth
methods.description: Gets the width of the text in pixels.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to get the width of

methods.name: sectionSymbolToAmpersand
methods.description: Returns the text with section symbols replaced by ampersands. Escapes `&` to `&&`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to convert

examples:
const newStr = Chat.sectionSymbolToAmpersand("§aHello World! I'm so happy & excited!");
// newStr will be "&aHello World! I'm so happy && excited!"

methods.name: ampersandToSectionSymbol
methods.description: Returns the text with ampersands replaced by section symbols. Escapes `&&` to `&`.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to convert

examples:
const newStr = Chat.ampersandToSectionSymbol("&aHello World! I'm so happy && excited!");
// newStr will be "§aHello World! I'm so happy & excited!"

methods.name: stripFormatting
methods.description: Returns the text with all section symbol formatting removed.

parameters.name: text
parameters.description: The text to convert

examples:
const newStr = Chat.stripFormatting("&aHello World! I'm so happy & excited!");
// newStr will be "Hello World! I'm so happy & excited!"
